title.narrative: Understanding Enterprises that Empower Women in Asia

description.narrative: Oxfam is interested in understanding the types of enterprises whose structural, governance or stakeholder engagement elements are effective in empowering women workers, farmers and community -members in Asia. These structural -elements of enterprises include the governance, management, ownership and decision -making models/structures that give greatest rewards and power to women workers, farmers and community members. There are a diversity of structures/models for enterprises that have some positive impact on empowering women and there is likely no single blueprint for gender -equitable enterprise structures. However, we want to identify the most empowering and equitable models currently in operation in Asia. These may include farmer, worker or community owned enterprises, or models where farmers, workers or communities or their representatives have meaningful decision -making power. There are existing frameworks that look to explain how enterprises could be pro -poor, including Social Enterprises with the Poor as Primary Stakeholders (SEPPS) that the Institute of Social Entrepreneurship in Asia (ISEA) has come up with, but these do not completely explain the characteristics of gender -equitable enterprises. The project's interest is to go beyond where there's a business case to empower women, and look at structural elements that drive pro -poor and pro -women decisions by enterprises on a number of fronts (even sometimes where the business/commercial case for inclusive or equitable treatment is weak or missing). These case studies should describe the structures that exist in a variety of enterprises across Asia. Oxfam will use the output of the research in our engagement with impact investors in Asia who are interested in investing into gender -equitable enterprises, and in our regional advocacy/influencing for our Gender -transformative Responsible Investment in Agriculture programme across Association of South East Asian Nations (ASEAN).
